episodes.title: Pilot
episodes.plot: The Pilot Version - The very first attempt at televising the QI format. No titles, background photos or set design as we later knew from the following Commissioned Series version. Its possible this Pilot was recorded relatively cheaply, unedited, "as live", as Stephen Fry refers to running out of tape, as the banter gets quite anarchic, and the running time hits 35 minutes, instead of the later tight 30 minutes.

episodes.title: Adam
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses various topics beginning with 'A', including Adam's navel, with his guests Danny Baker, Hugh Laurie and John Sessions.

episodes.title: Astronomy
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses all things astronomical with his guests Bill Bailey, Rich Hall and Jeremy Hardy.

episodes.title: Aquatic Animals
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses various aquatic animals with his guests Clive Anderson, Bill Bailey and Meera Syal.

episodes.title: Atoms
episodes.plot: Stephen Fry hosts the almost impossible quiz show with guests Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Howard Goodall and Jeremy Hardy. The theme of this edition of the show is atoms and questions range from Argentina to the composition of air.

episodes.title: Advertising
episodes.plot: Stephen Fry hosts the challenging quiz in which points are awarded. Alan Davies, Rob Brydon, Rich Hall and Gyles Brandreth face questions related to advertising - from Aristotle to alcoholics.

episodes.title: Antidotes
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses all things 'A' with his guests Danny Baker, Jo Brand and Howard Goodall, including various antidotes for ailments.

episodes.title: Arthropods
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses all things arthropods with his guests Jo Brand, Jimmy Carr and Jackie Clune.

episodes.title: Albania
episodes.plot: Stephen Fry's discusses what his sporty ancestor have to do with Albania, along with other things beginning with 'A' with his guests Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Sean Lock, Linda Smith.

episodes.title: Antelopes
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses all things African with his guests Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Dave Gorman and Jeremy Hardy.

episodes.title: Aviation
episodes.plot: Stephen discusses all things aviation with his guests Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Julia Morris and Peter Serafinowicz.

episodes.title: Arts
episodes.plot: Stephen Fry poses questions on the topic of arts to Alan Davies, Linda Smith, Bill Bailey and Richard E. Grant. Questions in this edition include - who invented the telephone and what is the most dangerous animal in Africa?

episodes.title: Advent
episodes.plot: Stephen Fry hosts a festive edition of the quiz show. Alan Davies, Sean Lock, John Sessions and Phill Jupitus attempt to identify the gender of Rudolf the reindeer and guess which Christmas decoration a German village exported worldwide.
